page.title: 02Farming-Kinoulton
page.content: Most of the land in our Domesday Area is farmland. There are ten farms, all of which are either{dairy}or{arable}farms. The most common breed of dairy cattle is the{Friesian}but other breeds like{Hereford, Charolais, {Limousins}and{Simmentals}are also present. The cows are milked twice a day - the milking parlour is usually of the{'herring-bone'}design.Although most cattle are kept for{milk}a few are kept for{beef}production. The farmland not given over to grazing is used for growing{crops - mainly cereal crops like Wheat and Winter Barley together with Oilseed Rape. One farm visited,{Newfield Farm,was once the home of{Colonel John {Hutchinson,a}signatory of{Charles I's death warrant.
